title: Staff MRI Technologist
description:
Overview
We are seeking a skilled MRI Technologist to join our medical imaging team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for operating MRI equipment to produce high-quality diagnostic images for interpretation by radiologists and physicians.

Duties
- Perform MRI scans on patients following protocols to ensure high-quality images
- Position patients correctly and provide clear instructions during the scanning process
- Monitor patients throughout the scan to ensure their safety and comfort
- Maintain accurate patient records and ensure patient confidentiality
- Operate and maintain MRI equipment, including performing routine safety checks
- Collaborate with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to ensure accurate imaging results

Qualifications
- Certification in MRI Technology or Radiologic Technology
- Proficiency in anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology
- Knowledge of diagnostic evaluation and medical imaging techniques
- Familiarity with CT scans, sonography, and aseptic techniques
- Strong attention to detail and excellent communication skills
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced healthcare environment

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $2,424.00 - $2,549.00 per week

Benefits:
• 401(k)
• 401(k) matching
• Dental insurance
• Employee assistance program
• Employee discount
• Flexible schedule
• Flexible spending account
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• Paid time off
• Parental leave
• Professional development assistance
• Referral program
• Retirement plan
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift

Experience:
• Anatomy knowledge: 1 year (Required)
• Medical terminology: 1 year (Required)

Ability to Relocate:
• Minneapolis, MN 55423: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm
description:
About the Role

We are seeking a talented Radiology Technologist - MRI/C-arm to join our team at RAYUS Radiology. As a key member of our imaging services team, you will be responsible for operating MRI and C-arm scanners to produce high-quality images of patients' bodies for diagnostic purposes.

Your primary focus will be on ensuring that patients receive accurate and timely diagnoses, while maintaining the highest standards of patient care and safety. You will work closely with radiologists and other healthcare professionals to achieve these goals.

Key responsibilities include:
• Performing routine and advanced MRI procedures
• Maintaining accurate patient records within the Radiology Information System (RIS)
• Cleaning and disinfecting equipment after each use
• Assisting with training new associates and providing technical expertise

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as opportunities for career advancement and professional growth.

title: Advanced Diagnostic Radiology Technologist - Neurosurgery
description:
Description

This is a full-time Advanced Diagnostic Radiology Technologist position located at our outpatient Neurosurgery (S-Clarizz Blvd). The hours will be Monday - Friday 8a-5p. No call, weekend or holidays required!

Sign-on bonus available to eligible applicants!

Performs diagnostic radiographic procedures for radiological diagnosis, in a timely fashion, while demonstrating the appropriate knowledge and skills necessary to work with patients from pediatric through geriatric. Follows physician's instructions, prepares and operates equipment and positions patients correctly in order to record the requested diagnostic images. Displays leadership characteristics by volunteering for improvement initiatives and intra/interdepartmental committees, seeking new ways to improve team collaboration and success, functioning as a subject matter expert, and acting as a mentor to assist in team development and coaching. Advanced responsibilities may include acting as an onboarding/orientation preceptor, serving as clinical instructor for students, providing and leading annual CE opportunities for team members, acting as the operations leader during the absence of a team lead/supervisor.
• Basic Life Support certification, required.
• Requires active status as a Registered Technologist - Radiography, RT(R) through the American Registry of Radiologic Technologists (ARRT).
• Requires current Indiana State Department of Health (ISDH) license as Radiologic Technologist.
• 3-5 years experience as a radiology diagnostic technologist, preferred.
• Requires ability to maneuver equipment and improvise positions when the condition of the patient does not permit routine positioning.

We are looking for team members who are passionate about challenging and significant work for the good of every patient. We are searching for individuals who are compassionate, serve with a purpose, are dedicated to supporting their team, and who seek excellence every day.

Sound like a perfect match? Apply now - we can't wait to hear from you!

#LI-Onsite

title: MRI Tech Career Opportunity
description:
Responsibilities and Requirements
• Specialize in Magnetic Resonance Imaging using advanced equipment such as Siemens 1.5T Sola, 1.5T Aera, and 3T Skyra scanners.
• Work in a hospital setting, Monday through Friday, from 2:00-10:30pm.
• Hold current certifications in CPR/BLS and ARRT-MR (Magnetic Resonance Imaging) and ARRT-R (Radiography).
• Meet state licensing requirements for Radiology Technologists in Minnesota.
Benefits and Compensation

Enjoy a tax-free stipend and competitive hourly rate ranging from $33.00-$39.00 per hour, based on an 8-hour shift.
Qualifications and Skills

Applicants should possess excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.

title: Sonographer - Patient Care and Medical Imaging
MRI Scanner Operator
description:
About Us

RAYUS Radiology is committed to delivering exceptional patient care and service.

We are seeking a dedicated MRI technologist to join our team and contribute to our mission of excellence in radiology services.

As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with state-of-the-art equipment and collaborate with experienced professionals.

Our goal is to provide patients with accurate diagnoses and effective treatment plans, and we rely on our team members to help us achieve this goal.

If you are passionate about delivering exceptional patient care and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply.

We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, including flexible scheduling and opportunities for professional growth and development.
